title: (x) Simple sans caps on Jason Anderson's "Showbiz" book cover - FB Eagle Light {Sindre}
content:
I often draw a blank on generic sans caps. Anyone has a clue what [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113214620/http:/bookcoverarchive.com/book/showbiz) could be? Note the rather low crossbar on the A.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113214620im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4134997650_c9bc663bf7_o_6483.jpg)
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Looks like [FB Eagle Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113214620/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Eagle/styles), possibly with a modified J.
Consider me officially impressed, Sindre. I would _never_ have guessed it could be Eagle, as I keep seeing it as a bold or black face. Thank you so much for helping me with this. :^)
You're very welcome! I don't think Morris Fuller Benton ever designed lighter weights (or even a lower case) for Eagle, and FB Eagle light is a bit of a visual oxymoron, in my opinion.
